intro: Micranthes stellaris var. paucidentata, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and grows in moist, woodland environments. It is part of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
